I want to buy two items: a laptop and a mouse. Please ensure the total cost does not exceed $1,500.

Hi Emma — I searched the store for laptops and mice and compared prices. With the current catalog I could not find any laptop + mouse combination that stays at or under $1,500.

What I found (products available right now):
- ViewPlus OmniBook Pro 14 (product_id: P044) — $1,499.00 (laptop)
- TechBrand Wireless Mouse (product_id: P001) — $79.99 (mouse)
- TechBrand Precision Wireless Mouse (product_id: P045) — $180.00 (mouse)
- KeyMaster Wired Reflex RGB Mouse (product_id: P046) — $219.00 (mouse)

Quick totals:
- OmniBook Pro 14 ($1,499.00) + TechBrand Wireless Mouse ($79.99) = $1,578.99 (exceeds budget by $78.99)
- OmniBook Pro 14 + any other mouse in the catalog is even more expensive.

I also tried searching for laptops priced <= $1,420.01 (which would be needed to keep the total ≤ $1,500 when paired with the $79.99 mouse) and there were no matching laptops in the catalog.

Options I can take next (tell me which one you want and I’ll proceed):
1) Increase your budget by at least $78.99 (total ≈ $1,579) so I can add the OmniBook Pro 14 + TechBrand Wireless Mouse to the cart.  
2) Buy only the laptop (ViewPlus OmniBook Pro 14) for $1,499 and add a mouse later. I can add the laptop to your cart now.  
3) Search again for cheaper laptops (refurbished/used or broader vendors) or wait for a sale — I can run those searches automatically and report any matches under your $1,500 total.  
4) Pick a different laptop/mouse combination if you’re willing to change preferences (brand, specs, rating). I can show all laptop options if you want to consider higher-priced mice or different tradeoffs.

Which option should I take? If you want me to search for refurbished/used laptops or expand filters (e.g., lower specs, other brands), I’ll run those searches now.
